title: How to Collect Business Cards

steps.headline: Save any business cards you come across, even duplicates.
Ask your friends, family and co-workers to save them for you.
Join several business card collecting groups/clubs.
Trade with other collectors if you start getting duplicates.
Go to paint stores, or hardware stores.
steps.description: Usually you will find many business cards, from people who want to paint your house, or put wallpaper on your walls, or clean the house.

steps.headline: Walk into your doctor or dentist, and pick up a card at the desk.
Look into buying a business card book to house your cards in.
steps.description: This ensures you do not lose your cards and they stay in good condition with easy access to them.

steps.headline: Organize your book how you wish.
steps.description: Useful ways are alphabetical or by business. That way, your book will not only be a collector's case, but a yellow book type reference as well.

steps.headline: If the card is from a famous or important person, have it signed.
steps.description: Business cards are a form of advertising, not a collectible. To determine the worth of your card, check the person who made it. It depends if that the man advertised on the card is famous or important, and if the card is signed.

tyn: Baseball card sheet protectors (for odd sizes)
text: Save any business cards you come across, even duplicates.  Ask your friends, family and co-workers to save them for you.  Join several business card collecting groups/clubs.  Trade with other collectors if you start getting duplicates.  Go to paint stores, or hardware stores. Usually you will find many business cards, from people who want to paint your house, or put wallpaper on your walls, or clean the house. Walk into your doctor or dentist, and pick up a card at the desk.  Look into buying a business card book to house your cards in. This ensures you do not lose your cards and they stay in good condition with easy access to them. Organize your book how you wish. Useful ways are alphabetical or by business. That way, your book will not only be a collector's case, but a yellow book type reference as well. If the card is from a famous or important person, have it signed. Business cards are a form of advertising, not a collectible. To determine the worth of your card, check the person who made it. It depends if that the man advertised on the card is famous or important, and if the card is signed. Finished.
sentences: Save any business cards you come across, even duplicates.
Ask your friends, family and co-workers to save them for you.
Join several business card collecting groups/clubs.
Trade with other collectors if you start getting duplicates.
Go to paint stores, or hardware stores.
Usually you will find many business cards, from people who want to paint your house, or put wallpaper on your walls, or clean the house.
Walk into your doctor or dentist, and pick up a card at the desk.
Look into buying a business card book to house your cards in.
This ensures you do not lose your cards and they stay in good condition with easy access to them.
Organize your book how you wish.
Useful ways are alphabetical or by business.
That way, your book will not only be a collector's case, but a yellow book type reference as well.
If the card is from a famous or important person, have it signed.
Business cards are a form of advertising, not a collectible.
To determine the worth of your card, check the person who made it.
It depends if that the man advertised on the card is famous or important, and if the card is signed.
